trustees.name: Trustee Raymond
trustees.title: Trustee
trustees.notes: Exited meeting after recess was called

meeting_summary: Special meeting to announce executive liaisons and conduct annual appointments. Meeting became contentious when Trustees Raymond and Baskin attempted to table all appointment votes until organizational meeting on January 6. After heated exchange during which Trustee Raymond raised his voice, Mayor called recess and both Raymond and Baskin exited. Remaining board members proceeded to approve all clerk appointments, staff appointments, and board/committee/commission appointments. Rules of Procedure amended and 2025 organizational meeting location changed.

votes.motion_description: Table consent agenda items 5, 6, 7 and motions 8a and 8b until official Organizational meeting on January 6, 2025
votes.notes: Motion failed 2-3; Trustees Raymond and Baskin wanted to delay appointments until organizational meeting

votes.motion_description: Rebecca Little be re-appointed Deputy Village Clerk for one year ending December 31, 2025

discussion.speaker: Trustee Raymond
discussion.statement: raised his voice when asked by Mayor Rossi for a point of information

discussion.speaker: Village Clerk O'Connor
discussion.statement: asked Trustee Raymond to please lower his voice

votes.notes: Discussion interrupted by recess due to Trustee Raymond raising voice; vote not completed before recess
Trustee Raymond continued to raise voice and did not vote; Trustee Baskin also did not vote

discussion.speaker: Mayor Rossi
discussion.statement: noted that Trustees Raymond and Baskin are absent at this point

discussion.speaker: Attorney Finocchio
discussion.statement: clarified that Chief Bush is not on the motion regarding the part-time Police Officers

votes.notes: Trustees Raymond and Baskin had exited meeting

votes.motion_description: Resume consent agendas as written in numbers 5, 6, 7
Reestablish consent agendas as written in numbers 5, 6, 7

Approve clerk appointments: Rebecca Little as Deputy Village Treasurer, Teri O'Connor as Registrar of Vital Statistics, Rebecca Little as Deputy Registrar of Vital Statistics, Village Clerk as Records Management Officer
votes.notes: All appointments for one year ending December 31, 2025

votes.motion_description: Approve staff appointments including Associate Village Justice, 12 part-time police officers, 2 crossing guards, Assistant Building Inspector, Fire Code Enforcement Officer, Inventory Control Officer, and Budget Officer
votes.notes: All appointments for one year ending December 31, 2025

votes.motion_description: Approve board/committee/commission appointments including Planning Board, Zoning Board, Sexual Harassment Committee, Park and Tree Board, Police Procedures Committee, Library Board, Committee on the Arts, and Historic District Commission
votes.notes: Notable: Robert Bush Jr. appointed to Planning Board alternate (formerly Nathan Ward's position); Mathew Ercoline appointed Planning Board alternate filling vacancy; Karen Avenarius appointed Zoning Board alternate filling vacancy; Janelle Coffey promoted to full Park and Tree Board member; Kristopher Dubuque promoted to full Park and Tree Board member; Gregory Mankes appointed Historic District Commission (formerly Gary Stephenson's position)

votes.motion_description: Approve changes to Rules of Procedure regarding meeting schedule and organizational meeting timing
votes.notes: Organizational meeting scheduled for first Monday in January, or first Tuesday if January 1st falls on Monday

votes.motion_description: Change location of 2025 Annual Organizational Meeting from 21 Milton Avenue to 66 Front Street and simultaneously at 150 West 56th Street, New York via Zoom on January 6, 2025 at 7pm
votes.notes: Clerk authorized to advertise meeting and change of location immediately

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.summary: Read a statement (full text attached to minutes but not included in transcript)

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: expressed his confusion over the name of this meeting and accused Trustee Price-Bush of being inappropriate regarding voting on the Part-time Police Officer appointments due to her being married to the Chief of Police.
opposes: Trustee Price-Bush voting on police appointments
public_comments.summary: Questions meeting name and raises conflict of interest concern about Trustee Price-Bush voting on police appointments (married to Police Chief)

board_response.response: clarified that Chief Bush is not on the motion regarding the part-time Police Officers

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: is disappointed her husband Nathan Ward was not notified he would not be reappointed as an alternate to the Planning Board.
public_comments.summary: Disappointed husband Nathan Ward not notified about non-reappointment to Planning Board

public_comments.comment_period: Public Comment on Agenda Items Only
public_comments.comment_text: expressed his disappointment with the matter as well and said he wasn't aware he had to reapply and is upset that no one reached out to him.
public_comments.summary: Disappointed about non-reappointment; unaware of need to reapply; upset no one reached out

trustee_responses.response: commented that Liaison appointments have traditionally been done at the Organizational meeting

mayor_announcements.speaker: Mayor Rossi
mayor_announcements.announcement: Addressing Trustee Raymond, who had previously stated he would not be in attendance tonight, Mayor Rossi noted that they will discuss the DPW offline.
action_items: Discuss DPW liaison assignment offline with Trustee Raymond

mayor_announcements.announcement: gave an overview of the history of appointments and meetings
